planet.name: Kepler-444 b
HIP 94931 b
KOI-3158.01
KOI-3158 b
KIC 6278762 b
LHS 3450 b
PPM 58152 b
TYC 3129-329-1 b
BD+41 3306 b
planet.description: This planet is part of the Kepler-444 system. The planetary system is tightly placked with at least 5 terrestrial planets. The host star formed 11 billion years ago, when the universe was less than 20 percent of its current age. This makes Kepler-444 the oldest known system of terrestrial size planets.
